ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about research methods in the field of nucleic acid research and how to approach the process of setting up scientific experiments.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really liked the hands on approach and the background information about each scientific method we used.

Weaknesses: Experiments often didn't go as planned, which is out of our control, but it make the class frustrating and quite disorganized at times. We frequently had to change protocols/plans on the fly, and most of the class felt confused and unsure what was happening. There was poor communication about what we were doing, when assignments were due, etc. It was difficult to stay engaged as a result.

Strengths: Professor Nelson is very kind and understanding. He frequently had to repeat our experiments for us for the sake of time. The TA was also really helpful and knowledgable. The different procedures were also helpful to learn, especially if you are pursuing research in the future.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Dr. Nelson is the best and this class is worth it for him. <3
Absolutely! It is a very interesting course where you get to participate in actual research!!
Yes. The class is interesting, fulfills your MCDB lab requirement in 1 semester, and Dr. Nelson is maybe the nicest teacher at Yale.

It might be a lower course load lab, but I don't know if I got as much out of this course as I expected. To be fair, it was no one's fault that the experiments didn't go as planned. If we were getting results and didn't have to repeat the same experiments multiple times, the class would've been more enjoyable. It is also highly dependent on your TA's grading. Overall, I would recommend it, since it really is dependent on your class's project. We just happened to be a bit unlucky this semester.

extras.title: MCDB 343L 01 - Laboratory in Nucleic Acids II
